title.narrative: Mapped in Bangladesh (MiB) IATI Reporting: July 2020 - June 2021

description.narrative: Mapped in Bangladesh (MiB) is a 4-year research initiative by BRAC University that aims to map the export-oriented ready-made garment (RMG) industry across all garment-producing districts in the country. MiB’s design and implementation is in response to the lack of essential sector data, such as, the actual number of factories that exist in the country, the number of male/female workers employed there, the kind of products they produce, the brands that work with them, etc. In line with the nation’s “Digital Bangladesh Vision 2021”, with the MiB tool, the RMG industry is expected to come one step closer to aligning itself to the mandated digitization of every sector. MiB (formerly “DRFM-B” – Digital RMG Factory Mapping in Bangladesh) is being implemented by BRAC University’s Centre for Entrepreneurship Development (CED) and coordinated by BRAC. The project is funded by Laudes Foundation with the co-funding by the Kingdom of the Netherlands (through EKN – Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands). Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) and Bangladesh Knitwear Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BKMEA) are the strategic partners of the project. The project is also supported by Department of Inspection for Factories and Establishments (DIFE) under the Ministry of Labour and Employment of the Government of Bangladesh. The project is being coordinated by BRAC.

MiB endeavors to do census of all the export-oriented ready-made garment (RMG) factories in Bangladesh and to provide accurate, credible and updated factory data that can generate various reports for major stakeholders, like brands and buyers, to make informed business decisions.

The key target impact that the project seeks to achieve is the launch of a transparency mechanism used by the industry. This is the first ever project to digitally map the sector and provide an opportunity to understand the universe of export-oriented RMG factories in Bangladesh. The Project, through its mapping and relationship building, will fuel Bangladesh’s RMG industry advancements and inspire shared responsibility and collective action. Mapped in Bangladesh can serve as an example for progress in the global garment industry, by taking into account what is learned in Bangladesh and applying it on an even larger scale. Mapped in Bangladesh strives to ensure the “Made in Bangladesh” brand represents the future of manufacturing ready-made garments, where strengthened and responsible practices are the norm.

The objective of Mapped in Bangladesh is to provide accurate, credible and updated RMG factory information to all industry stakeholders in a manner that enables greater efficiency, productivity, accountability and transparency. Designed and built in Bangladesh, this powerful tool serves as a home-grown solution that further strengthens the country’s significant and thriving RMG industry. The project aims to collect primary data about the export-oriented RMG industry and disclose information to the public in the form of an interactive online map. Driven by a collective action approach, Mapped in Bangladesh seeks input from all stakeholders through its crowd-sourcing platform, in order to keep the data accurate and up-to-date. Because of the growing need for credible, industry-wide data on the number of factories, their locations, number of workers, and much more, challenges remain across the Bangladesh RMG industry. This project is the first of its kind, providing a detailed industry-wide database of export-oriented RMG factories on an interactive, digital map (similar to Google Maps). This new platform is publicly accessible in order to catalyze transparency and bring about meaningful industry improvements in Bangladesh, and thus strengthen the sector as a whole.

activity-date.narrative: For the project's activity as per agreement amendment , the current reporting period's duration is 1 July 2020 to 30 June 2021.

The project was supposed to end on 30 June 2021 as per previous plan and agreement. However, the project received a no-cost extension from June 2021 to March 2022 (9 months). An agreement amendment (1st Amendment to the Contribution Agreement 4000003208 / 6005633) was signed in this regard.

recipient-country.narrative: The project is being implemented across the country.

sector.narrative: Digital mapping of all the export-oriented ready-made garment (RMG) factories in Bangladesh.

title.narrative: Factory Data Collection in Cluster 5 (Rest of the Districts)

description.narrative:
As a part of MiB’s ongoing census of Cluster 5 containing 60 districts all over Bangladesh, Field Officers have visited a total of 58 districts so far. During this reporting period, in these 58 districts after doing physical census, MiB Field Officers found export-oriented RMG factories in 20 districts, 38 districts have no factories that fit with MiB’s factory definition criteria.
Out of 20 districts where MiB Field Officers found factories, 19 districts have been fully covered (total 103 factories uploaded to the map as of 30 June 2021), 1 district is partially covered (Narsingdi), and another 2 districts are yet to covered that have factories (Tangail and Cumilla). Though the census was hindered by government imposed Covid-19 lockdown in July 2021, the data collection has started in August 2021 again, and is about to end soon.
The map contains a total of 3,336 factories from all 5 clusters, of which 2,665 are member factories and 671 are non-member factories, as of June 2021.

title.narrative: MiB Digital Map

description.narrative: The map presents factory data collected from Cluster 5

title.narrative: A total of 103 factories from Cluster 5 have been added to the map.

description.narrative: The targeted factories was around 150 to be collected from Cluster 5 during this reporting period. However, after data cleaning, verification, and validation, a total of 103 factories from Cluster 5 have been uploaded to the map as of 30 June 2021.

title.narrative: Data Update of 3 Clusters (Dhaka, Gazipur, Narayanganj)

description.narrative:
As a part of updating the data on the map for Cluster 1 (Dhaka District), Cluster 2 (Chattogram District), and Cluster 3 (Narayanganj District), MiB has been doing a separate survey for collecting the most updated data in case of the factories published on the map.
As of 30 June 2021, the data update is currently ongoing started from 25 March 2021 and is expected to end by February 2022.

title.narrative: Dhaka Cluster Data Update Status

description.narrative: Data update of Dhaka District (Cluster 1) started on 25 March 2021 and is currently continuing. The initial target was to collect 2000 factories within 6 months. As of 30 June 2021 under the reporting period, a total of 375 factories' updated data was collected from the targeted value 1000. The data update delayed due to Covid-19 hindrances.

title.narrative: Mid-line Evaluation of MiB Project

description.narrative: Center for Critical and Qualitative Studies (CQS) of University of Liberal Arts Bangladesh (ULAB), as a consultant, started working on the Mid-line Evaluation of MiB from 11 November 2019. In February 2020, CQS provided the first draft of the Mid-line Evaluation Report. CED worked on the report, and sent it back to CQS with the feedback of related project personnel in March 2020. In April 2020, the updated report (second draft) was sent to the funder for adding feedback from Ms Savi Mull (Senior Evaluation Manager, Laudes Foundation). The process of finalizing the report; however, was affected by the COVID19 situation, and was delayed. The submitted draft report was finalized in September 2020.

title.narrative: Midline Evaluation_Final Report

description.narrative: The Midline Evaluation (Final Report) of the project is uploaded to AidStream.

title.narrative: One evaluation report has been finalized.
Clusters Covered and Factories Published on the Digital Map

description.narrative: During this reporting period (1 July 2020 to 30 June 2021), MiB uploaded factory data 2 clusters, Cluster 4 (Chattogram District) in full and Cluster 5 (Rest of the Districts) in partial.

title.narrative: MiB Digital Map URL

description.narrative: This is the URL of the website containing the MiB digital map. It presents factory number on an interactive digital map and the factory profiles with essential data points.

title.narrative: Number of Clusters Covered and Number of Export-oriented RMG Factories Presented on the Digital Map

description.narrative:
As of 30 June 2021, a total of 386 factories from Cluster 4 and a total of 103 factories from Cluster 5 have been uploaded to the map.
A sum of 3336 export-oriented RMG factories on the digital map (2665 member factories; 671 non-member factories) as of 30 June 2020.

title.narrative: Media Outreach of Mapped in Bangladesh Project

description.narrative:
In order to promote and also for the outreach initiative of MiB, the project has started publishing articles using different printing and electronic media. The project believes that due to the circulation of these articles, more people will learn about the map and use it and thus the outreach purpose of the project will be attained.
The physical outreach activities of the project were hampered due to Covid-19, we are continuing through utilizing online measures only. Based on its outreach plan and also the recommendations of the MiB Midline Evaluation Report, MiB has been implementing its outreach plan for the promotion of the digital map targeting different groups of stakeholders of the sector as well as mass people. The project is following different measure for outreach such as: publication of newsletter/op-ed/blog, social media boosting, communications with advocacy groups, using BRAC's communication channel, organizing stakeholder meetings, publishing study reports and working papers, promotional and instructional videos on MiB, distribution of poster/leaflet, communicating with national and international organizations, etc.

title.narrative: MiB Coverage Links (National and Intl)

description.narrative: This document contains the links to news published by different national and international print and electronic media during July 2020 to June 2021. MiB was on the news more 60 national media, while 12 international media and research organization highlighted the project's activity.

title.narrative: Media Outreach of MiB
Stakeholder Engagement through Project Advisory Committee (PAC) Meeting

description.narrative: MiB project is the first of its kind to map export-oriented RMG factories across all garment-producing districts in Bangladesh, providing a detailed industry-wide database of factories, including subcontractors, on an interactive, digital map. In order to undertake such a huge challenge – the project is being guided by a multi-stakeholder Project Advisory Committee (PAC), focused on the stakeholder engagement in the from all relevant and essential entities. PAC includes representatives of workers, NGOs, donors, brand/buyers, employers, industry associations, right-based organization, and government representative(s).

title.narrative: Number of Project Advisory Committee (PAC) Meeting Organized

description.narrative: Though hampered by Covid-19, the project organized two (2) virtual PAC meetings on 29 September 2020 and 13 July 2021. At the last PAC meeting, MiB requested PAC members to assist the project to gain access to factories located in EPZs to include in the map. BKMEA representative suggested to use BGMEA-BKMEA channel for reaching out their member factories at EPZ areas.

title.narrative: Factory Data Collection in Chattogram (Cluster-4)

description.narrative: Started in December 2019, the main survey, i.e. the data collection from the RMG factories in Chattogram district (Cluster-4), had been delayed by Covid-19. About 10% data remained at hand to be collected as per the previous reporting period. MiB had to stop the data collection in March 2020 due to Covid-19. However, MiB started data collection of Cluster 4 in July 2020, but had to stop time to time because of intermittent lockdowns imposed by the Government. The field team completed the Cluster 4 and collected a total of 525 factories by April 2021.

title.narrative: Uploaded factory data from Chattogram (Cluster-4)

description.narrative: The map presents uploaded factory data from Chattogram (Cluster-4)

title.narrative: A total of 386 factory data uploaded to the map as of June 2021

description.narrative: By June 2021, all the data collected from Cluster 4 have been uploaded to the digital map. From the collected 525 factories, a total of 386 factories have been added under Chattogram district after completing data cleaning, verification, and validation.

title.narrative: User Outreach of the Digital Map

description.narrative: Statistics on the website hosting the map – user traffic; the number of unique visitors as per ISP address; geographical footprint; and click through rates (to the map). Number and type of media stories published on the digital map (including print/electronic/social media).

title.narrative: User Outreach Analytics for Use of Digital Map

description.narrative: Available details on the users who visited the digital map

title.narrative: Number of Disclosure and Transparency Mechanism

description.narrative: From the analytics report, some pointers observed as follows: Total users visited the site (during 1 July 2020 to 30 June 2021) are 29,142 having a unique page view of 55,250 (total page view). Most visitors are from Bangladesh (19,228), Indonesia (2,090), Greece (1,375), Portugal (1,333) and Cyprus (873). We had 68.8% Male and 31.2% Female from the total visitors. Major age range of the visitors are 25 to 34 years old. We had 29,119 new users having an average session duration of 1.34 Min on site. We have experienced some visitor spikes around March and April, among which the highest spike was during April 2021.
